translation:
n. 院子; 码（等于3英尺或36英寸或0。9144米）; 场地; 帆桁

分布：院子(85%)，庭院(15%)


→来自gher,围，围场，词源同garden.字母g,y的音变来自旧时书写混淆的产物。yard 桁，桅横杆，码
n.院子,场地;码Afterwards, I went toward the yard and looked upward, downward, inward, outward, forward and backward.后来我走向院子,向上下内外前后看.



US [jɑ:rd] noun countable UNIT OF MEASUREMENT  计量单位   ESSENTIAL  (written abbreviation yd) ■a unit of measurement equal to three feet or approximately 91.4 centimetres 码（相当于3英尺，约91.4厘米）
UK [jɑ:d] US [jɑ:rd] noun countable WORK AREA  工作场所   ADVANCED  ■an area of land in which a particular type of work is done, often one from which goods are sold （进行某种工作的）场地，场所；（常指出售货物的）场地
•a builders' yard建筑工地

•a scrap yard废料场
⇒ See also boatyard;dockyard;junkyard;lumberyard;shipyard;stockyard
UK [jɑ:d] US [jɑ:rd] noun countable LAND NEXT TO BUILDING  建筑物边上的地   ADVANCED  ■an area of land next to a building which is covered with concrete or other hard material 院子；天井；庭院
•The house has a small yard at the back.这所房子后面有个小院。

•the prison yard监狱里的院子
⇒ See also backyard;barnyard;farmyard
UK [jɑ:d] US [jɑ:rd] noun countable GARDEN  花园  US (UK garden) ■a piece of land next to a house, usually used for growing flowers, grass and other plants （房屋旁的）园圃，花园



n. 院子； [计量] 码（英制中丈量长度单位，1码=3英尺）； [建] 庭院；帆桁
 - courtyard, garth
examples: 英 [jɑːd] 美 [jɑːrd]
n.院子；庭院n.码(长度单位)

(1) I was out in the back yard splitting logs.(2) We planted some elms in the yard.(3) Her carriage was the most beautiful one in the yard.(4) He parked his car in the yard.(5) His quiet home sits back in his yard.(6) The trees formed a canopy over the yard.(7) Three feet make one yard.(8) Cloth is sold by the yard.
(1) 我那时正在后院劈柴。(2) 我们在院子里种了一些榆树。(3) 她的马车是院子里最漂亮的。(4) 他把车停在院子里。(5) 他那幽静家座落在庭院里端。(6) 树木覆盖著庭院。(7) 三英尺为一码。(8) 布是按码卖的。
[sound:youdao-68729ec8-4e5d8cb7-e5085c71-39c0e560-578ae45a.mp3]

translation:
vi. 打呵欠; 张开，裂开; <文学>张开大口
n. 呵欠; 无聊的人或事; 裂口

时态：yawned, yawning, yawns
分布：呵欠(56%)，打呵欠(31%)，张开(13%)


→来自ghai,张嘴，打呵欠，词源同gas,chaos,gape.
v.打呵欠n.呵欠At the dawn on the lawn the yawning drowned man began to frown.拂晓时在草坪上,打呵欠的溺水者开始皱眉头.
【记】因为yawn所以yaw（v 偏航）。



US [jɑ:n] verb intransitive  ADVANCED  ■to open the mouth wide and take a lot of air into the lungs and slowly send it out, usually when tired or bored 打哈欠
•I can't stop yawning - I must be tired.我不停打哈欠——肯定是累了。

UK [jɔ:n] US [jɑ:n] noun countable ■an act of yawning 哈欠
•Her eyes watered as she tried to stifle (= stop) a yawn.她强忍着不打哈欠，眼泪都出来了。
a yawn only singular informal ■something or someone that is very boring 乏味的事物（或人）
•We have to go to dinner with Simon's boss on Saturday which is a bit of a yawn.我们星期六得跟赛门的老板一起去吃晚餐，真是有点乏味。




n. 哈欠；裂口
 - breakage, chasm
vi. [生理] 打呵欠；裂开
 - gap, seam
vt. 张开；打著呵欠说
 - splay
examples: 英 [jɔːn] 美 [jɔːn]
v.打呵欠；张开n.呵欠；乏味的人（事）

(1) His long boring story made me yawn.(2) He closed the book, yawned, and went to bed.(3) The deep crevasse yawned at their feet.(4) I gave a loud yawn, but he just kept on talking.(5) He stretched himself with a yawn.
(1) 他的冗长的故事听得我直打呵欠。(2) 他合起书, 打了个呵欠, 然后上床睡觉了。(3) 他们脚下的冰川有一道深深的裂缝。(4) 我大声打了个呵欠，可他还是不停地讲下去。(5) 他打了个呵欠伸了伸懒腰。
[sound:youdao-325f51d9-8f77acff-5094db6b-ba57693d-1fe13c29.mp3]

translation:
n. 年; 年纪; 一年的期间; 某年级的学生

分布：年(93%)，年度(4%)，学年(2%)，年龄(1%)


→来自yer,季节，年，时间，词源同hour,horoscope,horology,horoscope,可能来自ei,走，离开，做，词源同ire（拉丁语，走，离开）,itinerary,由走动引申词义时间的循环，小时，季节，年，而hour和year在本质上都是指时间，词义只是人为赋予的结果。
n.年,年度,学年a./ad.每年,一年一次Next year the bearded bear will bear a dear baby in the rear.明年,长胡子的熊将在后方产一头可爱的小崽.



US [jɪr] noun  ESSENTIAL  countable ■a period of twelve months, especially from January 1st to December 31st 年，年份，（尤指一月一日至十二月三十一日间的）一年时间
•Annette worked in Italy for two years.安妮特在义大利工作了两年。

•1988 was one of the worst years of my life.1988年是我生命中最糟糕的其中一年。

•We went to Egypt on holiday last year.我们去年到埃及渡假。

•At this time of year the beaches are almost deserted.一年之中的这个时候，海滩几乎空寂无人。

•This species keeps its leaves all (the) year (round)(= through the year).这品种常年不落叶。
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■a period of twelve months relating to a particular activity （与某一活动有关的）一年，年度
•The financial/tax year begins in April.财政／纳税年度从四月份开始。
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■the part of the year, in a school or university, during which courses are taught 学年
•the academic/school year学年

•She's now in her final/first/second year at Manchester University.她眼下在曼彻斯特大学读毕业班／一年级／二年级。
countable + singular or plural verb UK ■a group of students who start school, college, university or a course together 年级
•Kathy was in the year above me at college.上大学时凯西比我高一届。

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun for a man/woman/person of his/her years ■considering how old someone is 就他／她的年龄而言
•He dances well for a man of his years.就他这个年龄的人来说，他跳舞跳得相当好了。

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun for years  ADVANCED  ■for a long time 很久，好长时间
•Roz and I have been going there for years.罗兹和我多年来常到那里。
 (also in years) ■since a long time ago 很久以来
•I haven't seen my uncle for/in years.我很长时间没见到我舅舅了。

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun from / since the year dot UK (US from/since the year one) informal  ■for an extremely long time 很长时间
•He's been in the local pantomime since the year dot.他很长时间以来一直在本地从事哑剧表演。

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun in/through all the years ■during the whole of a stated period of time 自始至终
•I've never once seen her angry in all the years I've known her.我认识她这么多年，从来没见她生气过。

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun of the year ■A thing or person of the year is one that has been chosen as the best in a particular year, especially in a competition （尤指竞赛中）年度最佳…
•Young Musician of the Year本年度最杰出的青年音乐家

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun put years on sb ■If something puts years on a person, it makes them appear much older 使（某人）显得苍老
•Being tired and unhappy puts years on you.疲劳和忧郁会使你显得苍老。

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun take years off sb ■If something takes years off a person, it makes them appear or feel much younger 使某人显得年轻；使某人觉得年轻
•"Have you seen James without his beard?" "I know - it takes years off him!"“你见过詹姆斯不留胡子的样子吗？”“我知道──那样令他看起来年轻好几岁！”

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun year in year out ■every year, especially in a way that seems boring （尤指单调沉闷地）年复一年，年年
•We go to Mike's parents every summer - it's the same thing year in year out.我们每年夏天都去麦克的父母家——年年如此。

UK [jɪər] US [jɪr] noun   Common Learner Errors   yearRemember:  After a number greater than 1, don't say 'year', say years :✗ I spent two year in London studying English.I spent two years in London studying English.



n. [天] 年；年度；历年
 - annum
examples: 英 [jɪə(r)] 美 [jɪr]
n.年；年度；年龄；学年

(1) Winter is the coldest season in a year.(2) The thief was put into prison for one year.(3) She was designated sportswoman of the year.(4) She is sixteen years old but has a mental age of five.(5) Mary will proceed to the degree of M.A. this year.
(1) 冬季是一年中最冷的季节。(2) 小偷被监禁一年。(3) 她被指定为本年度的体坛明星。(4) 她十六岁，而智力年龄是五岁。(5) 玛丽本学年将继续攻读硕士学位。
[sound:youdao-0f76a0de-aace4f0c-fc84fa7e-6eb73399-a682b4bb.mp3]

translation:
adj. 每年的，一年一度的; 一年间的
adv. 每年，一年一度; 在那一年间
n. 年利; 年鉴

分布：每年的(92%)，一年一次地(4%)，每年地(4%)


a.每年的,一年一度的ad.每年,一年一次地We pay a yearly visit to my uncle.我们每年都要看望我的叔叔.



US ['jɪr-] adjective adverb ■every year or once every year 每年（的）；一年一次（的）
•We get a yearly pay increase.我们每年加薪一次。

•Interest is paid yearly.利息按年支付。




adj. 每年的
 - annual, etesian
adv. 每年；一年一次
 - annually
n. 年刊；年鉴
 - annual, year book
examples: 英 ['jɪəli] 美 ['jɪrli]
adj.每年的adv.每年地；一年一次地

(1) The yearly conference will be held next month.(2) Many Greek cities had to send yearly tribute to Athens.(3) Property values appreciated yearly.(4) The meeting is held yearly.(5) I get a physical examination yearly.
(1) 年会下个月举行。(2) 许多希腊城市不得不每年向雅典进贡。(3) 财产价值每年都在增大。(4) 会议每年举行一次。(5) 我一年做一次身体检查。
[sound:youdao-8b6deeec-712fd129-56d4d7de-9f1804e9-f321894c.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 叫喊，大声叫; 叫喊着说
n. 叫喊，大声叫; （拉拉队鼓动运动员的）呼喊声

时态：yelled, yelling, yells
分布：大叫(53%)，大喊(47%)


→来自ghel,叫喊，呼喊，拟声词，词源同nightingale,yelp.
vi.大叫;呼喊vt.叫着说n.叫声;喊声The cellar-dweller yelled, "Fell the jellyfish burglar!"住地下室的人喊道:"打倒海蜇窃贼!"



verb intransitive or transitive  ADVANCED  ■to shout something or make a loud noise, usually when you are angry, in pain or excited （通常指生气、疼痛或激动时）叫喊，吼叫（着说）
•Our neighbours were yelling (obscenities) at each other this morning.今天早晨我们的邻居在互相破口大骂。

•The child yelled out in pain.孩子痛得大叫起来。

•[+ speech] "Just get out of here!" she yelled.“滚出去！”她大吼道。





call, scream, yell, roar, shriek, exclaim, shout, cry

这组词都有“喊”的意思，其区别是：
call: 指大声说话或喊叫，以引起某人的注意。
scream: 指因恐具、快乐或痛苦而发出的尖叫声。
yell: 多指求援、鼓励时的呼叫。也可指因外界因素刺激而发出尖厉声音。
roar: 指发出大而深沉的声音、吼叫或咆哮。
shriek: 指因惊恐、痛苦等或其它感情而发出比scream更为尖锐、刺耳的叫声。
exclaim: 多指因高兴、愤怒、痛苦、惊讶等突发感情而高声喊叫。
shout: 指有意识地高声喊叫，常用于提出警告、发命令或唤起注意等。
cry: 一般指因恐惧、痛苦、惊奇等而喊叫。


vi. 大叫，叫喊
 - scream out, shout out
n. 喊声，叫声
 - cry, wow
examples: 英 [jel] 美 [jel]
v.大叫n.大喊
(1) Don't yell at me!(2) You don't have to yell; I can hear you.(3) She yelled out at her mischievous child.(4) We yelled our good-byes as the bus left.(5) She let out a yell and ran home.
(1) 别对我大喊大叫！(2) 你用不著喊，我听得见。(3) 她对她淘气的孩子大喊大叫。(4) 汽车离开时我们大喊再见。(5) 她尖叫了一声跑回了家。
[sound:youdao-946974de-72ad5fd8-e17f28a1-a1e5a123-5d5f3e97.mp3]

translation:
adj. 黄色的; 黄皮肤的; 黄种人的; 胆怯的
vt. & vi. （使某物）变黄或发黄
n. 黄色; 黄种人; 黄色颜料

时态：yellowed, yellowing, yellows
分布：黄色(69%)，黄色的(29%)，黄种人(1%)，蛋黄(1%)


→来自ghel,发光，照耀，词源同gold,gall,glass,引申词义发黄色光，黄色的。
a.黄的,黄色的n.黄色The fellow's yellow pillow is hollowed by his follower.那个家伙的黄色枕头被他的跟随者掏空了.



US [-oʊ] adjective noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■(of) a colour like that of a lemon or gold or the sun 黄色（的）
•a bright yellow T-shirt亮黄色T恤衫

•It was early autumn and the leaves were turning yellow.正值初秋时节，树叶开始转黄。

•You should wear more yellow - it suits you.你应该多穿些黄色的衣服——那适合你。

UK ['jel.əʊ] US [-oʊ] adjective PEOPLE  人  offensive■belonging to a race that has pale yellowish brown skin 黄色人种的；黄皮肤的
UK ['jel.əʊ] US [-oʊ] adjective NOT BRAVE  胆怯的  informal ■cowardly  ; not brave 胆小的，懦弱的
UK ['jel.əʊ] US [-oʊ] verb intransitive or transitive ■to become yellow, or to make something become yellow （使）变黄



adj. [光] 黄色的；黄皮肤的
 - maize, xanthic
n. [光] 黄色；黄种人； [染料] 黄色颜料
 - sunking, giallo
examples: 英 ['jeləʊ] 美 ['jeloʊ]
adj.黄色的n.黄色；蛋黄；黄种人v.（使）变黄

(1) The leaves turn yellow in autumn.(2) The leaves of the book had yellowed with age.(3) She wore on her head a yellow kerchief.(4) Sunflowers are large flowers with yellow petals.(5) Yellow is the prevailing color in her room.(6) The yolk is the yellow part in an egg.(7) The pages of the book began to yellow.
(1) 秋天时叶子变黄。(2) 书页因年久而变黄。(3) 她头上带着一块黄色的头巾。(4) 向日葵是长着黄色花瓣的大花。(5) 黄色是她房间的主色。(6) 蛋黄是鸡蛋中的黄色部分。(7) 书页开始发黄了。

translation:
adv. 是; （表示刚想起某事）哦; （表示不相信某人所言）真的吗; （鼓励某人继续讲）往下说
n. “是”，“行”; 同意，答应; 肯定的回答; 赞成票

分布：是(72%)，是的(27%)，对…说是(1%)


→来自古英语gese,就是这样，ge-,是，词源同yea,se-,如此，词源同so.
ad.是[用于肯定句前],是的Answer with a simple 'Yes' or 'No.'.简单回答「是」或「不是」



adverb (informal yeah) (yep) (yah)  ESSENTIAL  ■used to express willingness or agreement （用于表示接受、愿意或赞同）好的，是的
•"Would you like a glass of wine?" "Yes please."“你想要来杯葡萄酒吗？”“好的。”

•"Do you like Thai food?" "Yes, I love it."“你喜欢泰国菜吗？”“是的，我喜欢。”

•"He's a really nice guy." "Yes he is."“他是个很不错的人。”“是的，没错。”

•"Report to me at nine o'clock tomorrow morning." "Yes, sir."“明早九时向我汇报。”“好的，先生。”

•"Have you had enough to eat?" "Yes, thank you."“你吃饱了吗？”“是的，谢谢。”

•If you'd say yes (= agree) to the request you'd save a lot of trouble.如果你同意这项要求，会省去很多麻烦。
 ESSENTIAL  ■used to show that you are listening to someone, or that you are ready to listen and to give them an answer or information （用于表示正在听某人说话，或准备听并作出回答或提供资讯）
•"Dad." "Yes, what do you want, honey?"“爸爸。”“怎么了，你想要甚么，宝贝？”

•Yes, can I help you?来了，能帮您甚么忙吗？
 ESSENTIAL  ■used when you are disagreeing with a negative statement （用于反驳否定陈述）
•"I'm not a very good cook though." "Yes you are - you make wonderful food!"“不过我不是一个很好的厨师。”“不，你是，你烹调的食物非常美味！”

[jes] adverb (informal yeah) (yep) (yah) oh yes (oh yeah) ■used when you have just remembered something that you were saying （用于表示刚想起某事）对了，想起来了
•What was I talking about - oh yes, I was telling you what happened at the party.我刚在说甚么——哦，对了，我正告诉你聚会上发生的事情。

[jes] adverb (informal yeah) (yep) (yah) yes and no ■used when you cannot give a particular answer to a question （用于表示难以作出明确回答）说不准，也是也不是
•"Is the job going okay?" "Well, yes and no."“工作顺利吗？”“唉，也顺也不顺。”

[jes] noun countable ■a vote supporting a particular plan of action or a reply accepting an invitation 赞成票；接受邀请
•"Have you had any replies yet?" "Six yeses and two noes so far."“你收到答覆了吗？”“到目前为止，六人赞成，两人反对。”




adv. 是
 - yeah, yep, yeh
n. 同意
 - agreement, Ok, leave, Okay, consent
examples: 英 [jes] 美 [jes]
adv.是；是的n.是（表示肯定）v.对…说是

(1) Yes, monsieur.(2) Yes, you're quite right.(3) Yes, I don't see why not.(4) Yes, it's still in my mind.(5) Yes, perhaps I'm wrong there.(6) Did he give a yes or a no to your idea?(7) Answer with a plain "yes" if you agree with me.(8) The boy kept yessing when his father was talking with him.
(1) 是，先生。(2) 是的，你很对。(3) 是的，我看不出有什么不好。(4) 是的，这事仍在我的记忆里。(5) 是的，在这点上也许我错了。(6) 他对你的想法表示赞成还是反对?(7) 如果你同意我的意见，就明白地回答“是”。(8) 那个男孩在他爸爸对他说话时连声说是。
[sound:youdao-7507b24c-ed56a29a-c25773cd-a1b14864-e61d8eaf.mp3]

translation:
n. 昨天; 往昔; <正式>过去
adv. 在昨天，在昨日; 近来

分布：昨天(85%)，近来(15%)


→yester-，昨日，以前，day,天。
n. & ad.昨天;前不久Yes, yesterday was the my pay-day; I pay you the payment today.是的,昨天是我的发薪日,我今天付给你报酬.



US [-tɚ-] adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■on the day before today 昨天
•He rang yesterday while you were out.昨天你外出时他打电话来了。

•I saw her yesterday afternoon.我昨天下午见到她。

UK ['jes.tə.deɪ] US [-tɚ-] noun uncountable ■the day before today 昨天
•"Is that today's paper?" "No, it's yesterday's."“那是今天的报纸吗？”“不，是昨天的。”
the day before yesterday ■two days ago 前天
•I rang her the day before yesterday.我前天给她打电话。
countable or uncountable ■the recent past 近日，日前；往昔
•Nobody's interested in yesterday's pop-stars.没人对过气明星感兴趣。

•These songs are a part of all our yesterdays.这些歌曲是我们所有往事的一部分。




n. 昨天；往昔
 - ayer
examples: 英 ['jestədeɪ] 美 ['jestərdeɪ]
n.昨天；近来adv.昨天；近来
(1) Yesterday was Friday.(2) I saw him only yesterday.(3) She had an attack of indigestion yesterday.
(1) 昨天是星期五。(2) 我昨天才见到他。(3) 她昨天消化不良。
[sound:youdao-e1175032-838b117e-0ac9ac5b-d1a7812d-ab383a8e.mp3]

translation:
vt. 屈服，投降; 生产; 获利; 不再反对
vi. 放弃，屈服; 生利; 退让，退位
n. 产量，产额; 投资的收益; 屈服，击穿; 产品

时态：yielded, yielding, yields
分布：屈服(58%)，生产(30%)，生产量(4%)，获利(4%)，投资收益(3%)，弯下去(1%)


→来自gheldh,支付，付款，引申词义屈服，词源同guild.其原义为加入行业公会，获取行业保护，引申词义出产，收获。
v.出产,生长;(to)屈服,服从n.产量,收获The land yields well.这块地收成好.
【反】outmaneuver（v 以策略制胜）；prevail（v 流行；成功）



verb PRODUCE  产生  transitive ■to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information 产生；出产；得出
•an attempt to yield increased profits提高利润的努力

•The investigation yielded some unexpected results.调查得出了一些出乎意料的结果。

•Favourable weather yielded a good crop.好天气带来了好收成。

[ji:ld] verb GIVE UP  放弃   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to give up the control of or responsibility for something, often because you have been forced to （常指被迫）放弃，让出
•They were forced to yield (up) their land to the occupying forces.他们被迫将领土割让给占领军。

•Despite renewed pressure to give up the occupied territory, they will not yield.尽管有新的压力要求放弃被占领的土地，他们就是不愿屈服。

[ji:ld] verb BEND/BREAK  弯曲／断裂  intransitive slightly formal ■to bend or break under pressure （受压）弯曲，折断，垮掉
•His legs began to yield under the sheer weight of his body.他的双腿连自己的体重也承受不住，开始弯曲。

[ji:ld] verb   Phrasal Verbs   yield to sth AGREE  ■to agree to do something that you do not want to do or should not do 服从，顺从，屈服于
•It's very easy to yield to temptation and spend too much money.很容易会抵制不住诱惑而挥金如土。

•"We will not yield to pressure," said the president.“我们不会向压力屈服，”总统说道。
STOP  US (UK give way) ■to stop in order to allow other vehicles to go past before you drive onto a bigger road 给（其他车辆）让道
[ji:ld] noun countable usually plural  ADVANCED  ■an amount of something positive, such as food or profit, that is produced or supplied 产生；出产；得出
•Crop yields have risen steadily.农作物产量稳步增长。

•Yields on gas and electricity shares are consistently high.天然气与电力股票的收益一直很高





submit, yield, surrender

这组词都有“让步，屈服”的意思，其区别是：
submit: 表示“甘心忍受”，作及物动词时，宾语为反身代词，但一般为不及物动词，后接介词to 。
yield: “投降”，与surrender 大致同义，但是指“温和的让步”。
surrender: “投降”，强调“被迫投降，压力很大”，是不及物动词，后接介词to；用作及物动词时，表因战败或被迫“交出”，“放弃”某些事物。



manufacture, yield, contribute, create, produce

manufacture: （强调机器成批）生产
yield: 生出、产生或提供（自然产物、结果或利润等）
contribute: 贡献出
create: 引起，造成（感觉或印象）
produce: 制造，引起，导致，带来



yield, harvest, crop

这组词都有“收成”的意思，其区别是：
yield: 指生产物，农作物的总产量。
harvest: 主要指农作物或水果的收获量，有时也指收割的行为。
crop: 普通用词，侧重指农作物一次收割或一季的收成。


vt. [力] 屈服；出产；放弃
 - desert, quit
vi. [力] 屈服，投降
 - succumb, to surrender
n. [经] 产量；收益
 - crop, output, harvest, proceeds
examples: 英 [jiːld] 美 [jiːld]
v.生产；获利；屈服；弯下去n.投资收益；生产量

(1) The village abounds in fields that yield many bushels of corn.(2) The combined investment is expected to yield $5,000 in the first year.(3) We' ve already made it clear that we will not yield to pressure.(4) The shelf is beginning to yield under that heavy weight.(5) So if the share price rises and the dividend does not, then the yield falls.(6) Wheat yields doubled last year.
(1) 那个村庄到处都是盛产玉米的农田。(2) 第一年该总投资有望获利5000美元。(3) 我们已经表明我们不会屈服于压力。(4) 架子被那么大的重量压得弯了下去。(5) 因此，如果股份上涨而股息不变，收益就下跌。(6) 去年小麦产量翻了一番。
[sound:youdao-bddd44c2-65867a11-d6ea0c4c-9cde0970-311811e8.mp3]

translation:
pron. 你; 你们，您们; 各位; 大家

分布：你(91%)，你们(9%)


→来自yu,二人称复数，词源同ye,并逐渐取代二人称单数thou,兼具单复数格。
pron.你;你们;一个人,任何人You can never predict what would happen next.谁也无法预料接着会发生什么事.



/jʊ] pronoun PERSON/PEOPLE ADDRESSED  所称呼的一个人／多个人   ESSENTIAL  ■used to refer to the person or people being spoken or written to 你；您；你们
•You look nice.你看起来不错。

•I love you.我爱你。

•You said I could go with you.你说过我可以和你一起去。

•You're coming tonight, aren't you?你今晚会过来，对吗?

•Are you two ready?你俩准备好了吗？

•You painted that yourself? You clever girl!那个是你自己画的？你真是个聪明的姑娘！
  Common Learner Errors   you or your?Warning:  do not confuse the pronoun you with the determiner your :✗ I was so pleased to receive you letter.I was so pleased to receive your letter.
[ju:] /jə] /jʊ] pronoun PEOPLE GENERALLY  泛指人   ESSENTIAL  ■people in general （泛指）你，任何人
•You learn to accept these things as you get older.年纪大些之后，你开始学会接受这些事情。

•You can't get a driving licence till you're seventeen in this country.在这个国家，17岁以下人士不能获得驾驶执照。

•Too much alcohol is bad for you.饮酒过量对身体有害。

•How do you get this thing to start?怎样才能令这东西启动？

[ju:] /jə] /jʊ] pronoun you got it US informal ■used to say that you will quickly do what someone has asked you to do 用于表示很快就完成对方要求你做的事情
•"Would you get me a coffee?" "Sure, you got it!"“你能帮我拿杯咖啡么？”“没问题，马上就来。”
examples: 英 [ju] 美 [jə]
pron.你；你们；(泛指)任何人
(1) Do you speak English?(2) I shall await you at seven-thirty or thereabouts.(3) You must all listen carefully.(4) Do you have a room available?(5) Nobody wants to help you in this town.
(1) 你会说英语吗？(2) 我将在7点30分左右等着你。(3) 你们都必须仔细听着。(4) 你们有空房间吗？(5) 在这座小城市里没有人愿意帮助别人。

translation:
n. 年轻; 青年，小伙子; 初期，少年（青年）时期; 〈集合词〉青少年们

分布：青年(50%)，青春(47%)，青年时期(3%)


→来自yeu,生命力，年青的活力，-th,名词后缀，用做young的名词形式。
n.青年;年轻人The young youths lounged in the south mouth of the cave for one month.无经验的青年们在南洞口闲荡了一个月.



noun PERIOD/STATE  时期   ESSENTIAL  [S or U] ■the period of your life when you are young, or the state of being young 青年时期；年轻，青春
•I was a fairly good football player in my youth.我年轻时是个相当不错的足球员。

•The first volume is the author's account of his misspent youth in the bars of Dublin.第一卷是作者对他在都柏林酒吧里虚度青春的叙述。

•He looks like a man who's found the secret to eternal youth (= staying young).他看上去似乎掌握了永葆青春的秘诀。

•You may not have played tennis as often as him, but at least you've got youth on your side (= you are young).你可能没像他那样经常打网球，但至少你有年轻的优势。

[ju:θ] noun BOY  小伙子   ESSENTIAL  countable disapproving ■a boy or a young man 毛头小伙；青年男子
•Gangs of youths were throwing stones and bottles at the police.一伙男青年在向员警投掷石块和瓶子。

[ju:θ] noun YOUNG PEOPLE  青年  uncountable [+ sing/pl verb] ■young people, both male and female, considered as a group （总称）青年，年轻人
•the youth of today如今的年轻人

•the nation's disaffected youth那个国家叛逆的年轻人





adolescent, teenager, youth, juvenile

这组词都有“年轻人，青少年”的意思，其区别是：
adolescent: 比teenager正式，侧重年龄。
teenager: 主要指13岁到19岁之间的青少年，强调这个年龄段的人的本身特点。
youth: 现在几乎专指男青年，尤指10多岁到20多一点的男青年，但作为集合名时间男女青年都可指。
juvenile: 指青少年，系法律上的常用词。


n. 青年；青春；年轻；青少年时期
 - green, prime, young man
examples: 英 [juːθ] 美 [juːθ]
n.青年时期；青春；青年

(1) In his youth, he had shown great promise.(2) He mused over memories of his youth.(3) Youth glided past without our awareness.(4) I can't bear young people casting away their youth.(5) The youth of the country are being ignored by politicians.(6) His brother is a member of a youth fellowship.
(1) 他在青少年时代就显得很有出息。(2) 他重温青年时期的往事。(3) 青春在我们不知不觉中逝去。(4) 我无法忍受年轻人虚掷青春。(5) 这个国家的青年没有受到政治家的重视。(6) 他哥哥是青年联谊会的会员。
[sound:youdao-cf0f36e9-14e864aa-b6451a4a-df0822c2-244ccbdb.mp3]

translation:
adj. 年轻的，有朝气的; 青年的; 早期的; 年轻气盛的

分布：年轻的(84%)，年轻人的(15%)，有青春活力的(1%)


['ju:θ.fəl] approving adjective ■having the qualities that are typical of young people 年轻人特有的；富有青春活力的；朝气蓬勃的
•At the time I admired his youthful enthusiasm.当时我很羡慕他那年轻人特有的热情。

•She has very youthful skin.她的皮肤非常细嫩。
■young 年轻的
•A youthful president can be good for a country's morale.一位年轻的总统可以有助于改善国家的精神面貌。





adolescent, youthful, juvenile, young

这组词都有“年轻的，年幼的”的意思，其区别是：
adolescent: 指13至16岁左右处于青春期的人，尚不成熟。
youthful: 褒义或贬义均可用。指具有青年人的外貌或年轻人应具有的品格。
juvenile: 较正式用词，一般12岁以下的少年，着重其生理和智力上的不成熟。
young: 强调年龄小，处于生长的前期。


adj. 年轻的
 - young, baby-doll
examples: 英 ['juːθfl] 美 ['juːθfl]
adj.年轻的；有青春活力的；年轻人的；(地质学)幼年期的

(1) No one can remain youthful forever.(2) His youthful escapades came back to haunt him.(3) He was youthful but white-haired.(4) If you want to retain youthful vigor,you have to take regular exercise.(5) He was full of youthful idealism.(6) He was full of youthful curiosity.
(1) 没有人能永保青春。(2) 年轻时的胡作非为时常令他感到苦恼。(3) 他虽已白发苍苍,却仍然朝气蓬勃。(4) 如果你想保持青春活力，你就得经常锻炼。(5) 他满脑子都是年轻人的理想主义。(6) 他充满了年轻人的好奇。
[sound:youdao-a50fb04a-a560d6d3-cb167ae6-15910cbd-c4ee1ca1.mp3]
